result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen J. Martin

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on November 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:30 PM cases 22CM620, 22CF31, 21CF316, 22CF739 called. Defendant Stephen J. Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Stephen J. Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties stipulate to the doctor's findings that defendant is incompetent to proceed but likely to regain competence within statutory timeframe. 
Court finds there is probable cause to the crimes committed in 22CF31, 21CF316 and 22CF739 and finds defendant is incompetent to proceed but likely to regain competence within statutory timeframe.
Files to be indefinitely suspended. 
Clerk notes competency order and the findings of the doctor do not include 22CM620 and case won't be suspended. 
Parties ask the initial appearance in 22CM620 be adjourned until next hearing date.

(12:01 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Stephen J. Martin does not appear in court or via Zoom. Defendant is in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail.
State notes the defendant is in custody and is refusing to cooperate and appear.
State requests Court review the criminal complaint.
State requests signature bond and for the Initial Appearance to be adjourned to date and time of defendant's other open pending cases.
Court orders signature bond and defendant is to appear for Initial Appearance on date and time as other cases are scheduled.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
